speaker: Shadow Market
lines: Stalls set up where no road leads; lanterns hang from hooks that don't cast shadows.
Vendors drape their wares in sighs: a jar of rain kept from falling, a smile borrowed from winter.
A hound asleep on a rug dreams with its eyes open and its nose closed.
Coins here are stories; they clink in your pocket when you remember them.
A seller of glimmers offers one that looks like your reflection finally agreeing.
At the market's center, a stump serves as a scale: heart on one side, twig on the other.
The crier rings a bell with no clapper; the sound arrives from your childhood.
You realize the market opens for those who don't look for it and closes for those who stay.

choices.text: Trade your twig bundle for something that fits your hand.
Buy a glimmer with a story you haven't told yet.
Leave before prices remember to rise.
